Detailed Description

Base class of the command line argument.

This is an argument with one parameter or without any parameters.

Member Function Documentation

QChar QtArg::flag (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Returns:
Flag of the argument. Returned value is a first flag from the list of flags if defined more than one.

void QtArg::setFlag ( const QChar &  fl  )  [inline, virtual]

Set new value of the flag of the argument.

Clears all previously defined flags from the list and set this new value.

Parameters:
fl  New value of the flag.

void QtArg::setFlags ( const QtArgIface::FlagsList &  f  )  [inline, virtual]

Set new value of the flag's list of the argument.

Clears all previously defined flags from the list and set this new values.

Parameters:
f  New value of the flag's list.

QString QtArg::name (  )  const [inline]

Returns:
Name of the argument. Returned value is a first name from the list of names if defined more than one.

Returns:
Is this argument required?
Return values:
true if argument is required.
false if argument isn't required.

bool QtArg::isDefined (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Returns:
Is this argument defined in command line?
Return values:
true if argument has decided he has been defined.
false if argument hasn't decided he has been defined..

Implements QtArgIface.

bool QtArg::isWithValue (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Returns:
Whether this argument should have a value or not.
Return values:
true if this argument should have a value.
false if this argument shouldn't have a value.

Implements QtArgIface.

virtual void QtArg::check ( const QChar &  delimiter,
FlagsList &  alreadyKnownFlags,
NamesList &  alreadyKnownNames 
) const [virtual]

Check correctness of the names, flags and so on before parsing.

Exceptions:
QtArgDissallowedFlagOrNameEx 
QtArgNameOrFlagAlreadyKnownEx 
Parameters:
delimiter  Delimiter character.
alreadyKnownFlags  All known flags in every argument.
alreadyKnownNames  All known names in every argument.

Returns:
Description of the argument.

Implements QtArgIface.

QString QtArg::longDescription (  )  const [inline, virtual]

If long description is empty it's better to return description().

Returns:
Long descrition for this argument.

Implements QtArgIface.

QtArgIface * QtArg::giveArgument ( const QChar &  flag  )  [inline, virtual]

Should return pointer to the QtArgIface if this argument know how to do it, usually returns "this" if he does.

If this argument handles another arguments with flag flag than he should return pointer to this argument.

Return values:
Pointer to the QtArgIface if flag flag determines this argument.
NULL if flag flag doesn't determine this argument.
Parameters:
flag  Is a flag that returned argument should own. If this argument doesn't own this flag or sub-arguments don't own this flag then returned value should be null-pointer.

Implements QtArgIface.

QtArgIface * QtArg::giveArgument ( const QString &  name  )  [inline, virtual]

Should return pointer to the QtArgIface if this argument know how to do it, usually returns "this" if he does.

If this argument handles another arguments with name name than he should return pointer to this argument.

Return values:
Pointer to the QtArgIface if name name determines this argument.
NULL if name name doesn't determine this argument.
Parameters:
name  Is a name that returned argument should own. If this argument doesn't own this name or sub-arguments don't own this name then returned value should be null-pointer.

Implements QtArgIface.

const QtArgCmdLineIface::QtArgumentsList & QtArg::arguments (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Usually returns list with "this" pointer or list with all handled arguments.

Returns:
List of the arguments handled by this argument.

Implements QtArgIface.

void QtArg::checkConstraint (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Check correctness of the argument constraint.

Exceptions:
QtArgContraintNotObservedEx if constraint didn't observed.

Implements QtArgIface.

Reimplemented in QtMultiArg.

Can throw exceptions.

Returns:
